line_1: And to himself began his simple plaint.
line_2: Lone, o'er a new-heaped grave poor Basil bent,
Still for thy weakly self is spent

line_1: Much was I grieved at her piteous plaint,
line_2: At length, tho' late, thou hast found out a saint,

line_1: Her mournful voice, her moving plaint,
line_2: She flew — she gave her sorrows vent —

line_1: When by Euphrates' stream they made their plaint:
line_2: Angelic harps, to sooth a dying saint.
